lead: Exploring the intersection of technology and health, from AI-driven healthcare solutions to the impact of digital habits on well-being.

stories.title: Amazon is adding AI-powered assistant to One Medical
stories.summary: Amazon's introduction of 'Health AI' to One Medical aims to offer personalized health guidance based on individual medical records. This AI tool can assist with understanding lab results, managing medications, and scheduling appointments. While it promises to enhance patient care, concerns about data privacy and the extent of medical advice provided by AI remain prevalent.

stories.title: Best Indoor Bike Trainers to Push You Toward Your Health Goals in 2026
stories.summary: As fitness enthusiasts gear up for 2026, CNET reviews the best indoor bike trainers that can help maintain healthy habits regardless of weather conditions. These trainers cater to various fitness levels and preferences, making it easier to stay committed to health goals from the comfort of home.

stories.title: Surveillance and ICE Are Driving Patients Away From Medical Care, Report Warns
stories.summary: A recent report highlights a 'health privacy crisis' where surveillance and ICE enforcement are deterring patients from seeking necessary medical care. The findings underscore the need for improved privacy protections in healthcare to rebuild trust and encourage individuals to seek treatment without fear of repercussions.

stories.title: My friends in Italy are using AI therapists. But is that so bad, when a stigma surrounds mental health?
stories.summary: In Italy, the use of AI therapists is becoming more common as traditional mental health services struggle to meet demand. This trend raises questions about the stigma surrounding mental health and the acceptability of turning to technology for support. The conversation reflects a broader societal shift towards integrating digital solutions in personal health management.

stories.title: My analogue month: would ditching my smartphone make me healthier, happier – or more stressed?
stories.summary: A personal experiment of living without a smartphone reveals the impact of digital devices on mental health and awareness. The author reflects on how disconnecting from technology altered their perception of reality and interactions with the environment, sparking a dialogue about the balance between digital life and mental well-being.

stories.title: Meta Seeks to Bar Mentions of Mental Health—and Zuckerberg’s Harvard Past—From Child Safety Trial
stories.summary: As Meta faces a child safety trial, the company is attempting to limit discussions around mental health and its founder's past. This legal maneuver highlights the ongoing scrutiny tech companies face regarding their impact on mental health, particularly among young users.

stories.title: AI initiatives without the risk: My guide to methodology-driven success
stories.summary: A CIO discusses the importance of structured methodologies in AI projects, particularly in healthcare. By aligning objectives and ensuring compliance with regulations like HIPAA, organizations can mitigate risks associated with AI deployment in sensitive areas like patient care.

stories.title: He called himself an ‘untouchable hacker god’. But who was behind the biggest crime Finland has ever known?
stories.summary: The Vastaamo hack exposed sensitive therapy notes of thousands of patients in Finland, raising significant concerns about data security in mental health services. The incident highlights the vulnerabilities in digital health records and the critical need for robust cybersecurity measures to protect patient privacy.
